snippet: In Silicon Valley, dismay at revelations about government monitoring has led some to call for disclosure of companies’ involvement.
abstract: Dismay at revelations about government monitoring has led some in Silicon Valley to call for disclosure of involvement of companies like Microsoft, Google, Yahoo, Apple and Facebook; companies deny directly working with government on project known as Prism, but have not been forthcoming in discussing how they are working indirectly and where they would draw line.

byline.original: By DAVID STREITFELD and QUENTIN HARDY

lead_paragraph: In Silicon Valley, dismay at revelations about government monitoring has led some to call for disclosure of companies’ involvement.

headline.main: Data-Driven Tech Industry Is Shaken by Online Privacy Fears
headline.print_headline: Data-Driven Tech Industry Is Shaken by Online Privacy Fears
